intro: Scolopia braunii, commonly known as the Braun's false hellebore, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Araceae and is characterized by its thick, fleshy rhizomes and arrow-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, greenish-white flowers surrounded by a spadix, typical of the arum family. Its botanical features include a short, erect stem and a distinctive, waxy leaf surface. Scolopia braunii is often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
